body:
I implemented option 2, creating a button that changes the selected theme upon clicking. It uses two icons to identify, in this case, the current theme. There was also the option for the button to display the icon of the theme that would be applied upon clicking. Personally, I don't think there's any difference between the two approaches; both are used. The React website (https://react.dev/) uses the second option described, while the site of Docusaurus, for example, uses the one I implemented (https://docusaurus.io/).

Let me know what you think, also regarding the position. If you want, we can open a dedicated issue for applying the ISO 639-1 format for the language, especially since I noticed that some texts are missing for French and Chinese, I don't know if it's intentional ("Run Query" for example).

If it's okay, I will soon start thinking about some tests that can be implemented.

Thanks for the progress. So, about positioning, I meant to put both controls to the right of the search bar because as you noticed, things start to feel more odd when they are "sandwiched" together. It is a mix of UI controls and actual functionality. Notably, the "upload trace" which is an alternative to choosing one, is between UI controls now.

![Screenshot 2024-04-06 at 07 33 35](https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/assets/64215/9e74f0a0-269f-4a56-a39b-bed23a0f1704)

I do like the icon.. you chose.

For ISO 639-1, I think let's limit it simply to shortening to keep your work down especially as I'm not likely to do a lot of PR review when on vacation. So, use the 2 letter code instead of long form. You can do that in a PR to merge before this one, then rebase this, or you can do it here. In any case, I think merging this without that done adds weight to the top bar, especially for folks like me who use low resolution due to "old man eyes" ;)

Here, I think the main change is to move both UI controls and to the right of the vertical line. When we release this code, we can ask for feedback. As you notice, no one else is giving feedback, so we have to do our best then let community tell us if they didn't like it.

On the glitches in translations, I'm not entirely surprised. If you want to do a PR to fix some of the gaps, please do.

Cheers!

Sorry for writing only now. I have made changes based on what we discussed. This is the final result. I preferred to directly push the changes to the ISO 639-1 language selection and also a couple of missing translations.
And here's the before and after. The top-bar controls use about the same space as they did before, and better organized IMHO before: after:

great work @giaroc, I tried my best to summarize the points in the commit message https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/commit/03c9588110afdfd1e917db33c1b2ddaa54c8d073 (this org squashes always, so it is one commit on merge)

> great work @giaroc, I tried my best to summarize the points in the commit message [03c9588](https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/commit/03c9588110afdfd1e917db33c1b2ddaa54c8d073) (this org squashes always, so it is one commit on merge)

Thank you @codefromthecrypt  for the feedback, the analyses, and the excellent advice. The final result looks great!
`trivy repo . --scanners vuln` doesn't show benchmarks in it
lint is broken due to this: https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/pull/3757
docker is also broken (bad build day sheesh) fixed by #3758, which is broken due to lint until this is merged ;)
fixed https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/releases/tag/3.2.0
thanks for the eyes, folks

we've clarified our security process here, which is less than what you'd expect for a commercially staffed operation, yet more than most ad-hoc groups I suspect. https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/blob/master/SECURITY.md
zipkin is all the latest things lately
trivy is enabled and there are no current CVEs in our prod image
zipkin tests run against our docker image which is MySQL 10.11.7
trivy is enabled and there are no longer any high/critical CVEs
please re-open if you have an issue with a current version of zipkin

zipkin was renovated at the end of last year including updates to all things including JRE and alpine. Closing this out, but if you have something with a current version, please ping back. FYI [zipkin-helm](https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin-helm) is also much renovated, for those using k8s

@reta a hint here is that we made `LazyHttpClient` to allow aws variant to customize things. It is perfectly fine to add things to the ElasticsearchStorage component that make this easier for you to achieve. swapping a function or two may let this all work.

this project doesn't package generated proto code for external use. We have `SpanBytesEncoder.PROTO3` which does the same thing, and has no deps.

zipkin-proto3 is only used in our tests. we don't want to publish generated code for protos as they tend to drift across grpc versions. We use [square wire](https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/blob/master/zipkin-server/pom.xml#L490-L504), not protoc for tests.

If you want to use google protoc, you probably want to extract zipkin-proto3, from the https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin-api project like this. Then you can use the normal protoc generation process.

```
    <dependency>
      <groupId>io.zipkin.proto3</groupId>
      <artifactId>zipkin-proto3</artifactId>
      <version>${zipkin-proto3.version}</version>
      <scope>provided</scope>
    </dependency>

--snip--
        <plugin>
          <artifactId>maven-dependency-plugin</artifactId>
          <version>${maven-dependency-plugin.version}</version>
          <executions>
            <!-- wire-maven-plugin cannot get proto definitions from dependencies: this will -->
            <execution>
              <id>unpack-proto</id>
              <phase>generate-sources</phase>
              <goals>
                <goal>unpack-dependencies</goal>
              </goals>
              <configuration>
                <includeArtifactIds>zipkin-proto3</includeArtifactIds>
                <includes>**/*.proto</includes>
                <outputDirectory>${unpack-proto.directory}</outputDirectory>
              </configuration>
            </execution>
          </executions>
        </plugin>
```
sounds like you are asking for a sidecar, so that you can configure your application to report to localhost, right?
if you still have questions, please join gitter to ask them https://app.gitter.im/#/room/#openzipkin_zipkin:gitter.im

I'm assuming this is about in-memory storage, which isn't a production config, but I know people use it anyway ;)

As the JVM and other infrastructure changed lately, and this topic shouldn't have anything to do with sleuth. I'd suggest if someone is interested to use our docker examples as they are known working configurations.

https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/tree/1ed6c4a3c337257e7890be8932dca133789ffa33/docker/examples#example

then, hit localhost:8081 with any additional monitoring configuration you desire. If something actionable turns up, please comment and we can consider re-opening the issue.
closing this as it is very out-of-date, and the related issue hinted at a non-standard setup.
as the javascript infrastructure changed, possibly there's no issue any more. If there is, please reply back.

We can only support things that are top-level config via ENV variables, even if things passed through java opts or spring config might work.

In other words, trying to detect this config via scraping JAVA_OPTS or spring properties.. and handle it in the health check... it won't likely work out well. Meanwhile, trying would add technical debt to the maintenance responsibilities here.

I would recommend you overwrite the docker-healthcheck on the image via a new image, volume mount or otherwise. K8s won't read it anyway.
ps anyone who has a workaround to share, please comment here!

I think it is easiest to make the image first in a separate PR. Then, merge and we can use it.

I don't recall the history of the feature ask, but if someone hasn't asked for 1.x maybe better to only do 2.x because there's a linear time increase per images.  Usually we don't add old versions as a first storage option.

At any rate, you would do a PR for the image, and make sure it is in the docker readme test workflows etc. When that merges, after master builds clean, you can re-cut the last version docker images as docker-x.x.x. Finally, as it is a new image, it will be private by default, so you need to click to make it public https://github.com/orgs/openzipkin/packages
the cve is eureka. I'll help raise a PR https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/actions/runs/8761712611?pr=3766

> Thanks @codefromthecrypt !

no worries
thanks for taking this forward, @reta!

@reta for the error around `ghcr.io/openzipkin/zipkin-opensearch2:3.3.1` you want to push a tag docker-3.3.1 off latest master. this will re-publish and also include the new one, unless we missed a spot somewhere.
also don't forget to set this public https://github.com/orgs/openzipkin/packages/container/zipkin-opensearch2/settings

> @reta for the error around `ghcr.io/openzipkin/zipkin-opensearch2:3.3.1` you want to push a tag docker-3.3.1 off latest master. this will re-publish and also include the new one, unless we missed a spot somewhere.

Thanks @codefromthecrypt , it seems like we need to make a 3.3.1 release first since Docker images are looking for Zipkin 3.3.1 bits ...
@reta oh sorry.. I didn't remember what release was current. change the test code to use 3.3.0 and re-cut docker-3.3.0. that's the simplest way and will get the new test image

> also don't forget to set this public https://github.com/orgs/openzipkin/packages/container/zipkin-opensearch2/settings

@codefromthecrypt apologies, I see the image is 100% pushed but I cannot see it in the `Packages`, is it my permissions? ~(because it seems like I cannot change visibility level for existing packages as well)~ I see that I could change the visibility for existing packages
switched visibility to public ;) https://github.com/orgs/openzipkin/packages/container/zipkin-opensearch2/settings

when ready, re-prep the PR description, after making sure any markdown that need a usage example update have been so. Also, anything in general READMEs about things we test mention opensearch since after this, it is true.
also bump poms 3.3.1-SNAPSHOT -> 3.4.0-SNAPSHOT as def not a patch ;)
also I think a question originally was about hosted aws opensearch (zipkin-aws). want to try integrating with that via snapshot locally prior to mark this for review?

> also I think a question originally was about hosted aws opensearch (zipkin-aws). want to try integrating with that via snapshot locally prior to mark this for review?

Absolutely, thanks @codefromthecrypt !

> also I think a question originally was about hosted aws opensearch (zipkin-aws). want to try integrating with that via snapshot locally prior to mark this for review?

@codefromthecrypt I have to admit failure to verify the flow, I was not able to get AWS managed OpenSearch instance(s) for testing purposes. On an optimistic note, AFAIK the managed OpenSearch uses the same open source distribution and should work seamlessly.
okie dokie. I'm a bit swamped, but if I've not reviewed this by saturday, nag me as I should be able to get time to look closely by then.

> Do you know if zipkin-dependencies works with OS using the current driver?

Ah, thanks a lot for pointing it out @codefromthecrypt, it won't work with Elasticsearch, we will need to add OpenSearch module alongside the Elasticsearch one.

let's hold merging this until that's sorted out as I don't want to have a new storage option that doesn't work due to zipkin-dependencies (bomb)

> let's hold merging this until that's sorted out as I don't want to have a new storage option that doesn't work due to zipkin-dependencies (bomb)

I could pick it up later this week, very likely over the weekend (the good thing, AFAIK OpenSearch has Spark / Hadoop support on par with Elasticsearch)
thanks @reta!
I very much need this. Did you ever figure out a work-around to achieve this?

> If Zipkin can write to an alias (without any date math) then you could set that up with with ILM (https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/overview-index-lifecycle-management.html) in the background. That this was part of Zipkin is probably more for historic reasons when Elasticsearch lacked any such features, but things have luckily changed by now.

I'm also very interesting in such a feature! When storing lots of traces with Zipkin, due to the size of the index, using ILM feature as shrinking or force merging becomes problematic. If we could write to an alias instead, we could automatically roll over the indices every 50GB, seriously reducing the batch size when shrinking and force merging

> fine to make one for spring-boot only, but I tend to bump all deps before a patch release. If you are up to it, can you audit? Otherwise, I'll do post merge

Sure, will do!
@codefromthecrypt we should be all set, thanks for looking!
thanks a lot for the help, I'll cut a patch now!
actually I will bump alpine first

curse of neglected cassandra strikes again. alpine no longer has a python 3.11 package. there seem to be some workarounds mentioned in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CASSANDRA-19206

Maybe we can avoid installing the schema, just delete that part and try it (delete schema stuff from install.sh including setup of python, publish image local, change CassandraContainer to use that version and run ITs for cassandra)? @reta if you have time to try this please do as I'm in a jungle right now ;)

> @reta if you have time to try this please do as I'm in a jungle right now ;)

Will do shortly

ps also maybe adding cassandra's nodetool is an alternative (if it isn't also python hell)
https://cassandra.apache.org/doc/latest/cassandra/troubleshooting/use_nodetool.html

next, I looked and failed to use https://github.com/jeffwidman/cqlsh without six as the cassandra issue described

https://github.com/jeffwidman/cqlsh/pull/37 < said it can remove the dep

```
$ apk add git
$ pip install git+https://github.com/jeffwidman/cqlsh@master
$ cqlsh
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/java/.venv/bin/cqlsh", line 5, in <module>
    from cqlsh.__main__ import main
  File "/java/.venv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/cqlsh/__main__.py", line 3, in <module>
    from cqlsh.cqlsh import main as cqlsh_main
  File "/java/.venv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/cqlsh/cqlsh.py", line 134, in <module>
    from cassandra.cluster import Cluster
  File "/java/.venv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/cassandra/cluster.py", line 173, in <module>
    raise DependencyException("Unable to load a default connection class", excs)
cassandra.DependencyException: Unable to load a default connection class
The following exceptions were observed: 
 - The C extension needed to use libev was not found.  This probably means that you didn't have the required build dependencies when installing the driver.  See http://datastax.github.io/python-driver/installation.html#c-extensions for instructions on installing build dependencies and building the C extension.
 - Unable to import asyncore module.  Note that this module has been removed in Python 3.12 so when using the driver with this version (or anything newer) you will need to use one of the other event loop implementations.
```

Finally, another way could be to make a main class in the cassandra storage that executes the EnsureSchema function directly, then we can install the schema without any deps. It might imply adding more content to the .dockerexclude file

Thanks for the help!

> next, I looked and failed to use https://github.com/jeffwidman/cqlsh without six as the cassandra issue described

Should be good now @codefromthecrypt , the only thing you've missed is that `asyncore` was switched to `libev` for 3.12, needed `libev` to be installed, thanks for doing all the hard work as always!

I was able to resolve this error by removing my manually defined index template for zipkin spans. For some reason the traceId was getting mapped to text. When I use the one generated by Zipkin, it maps traceId to keyword only which allowed me to perform searches in the Zipkin ui.
thanks for explaining your resolution, as it helps the next person!
Just needed to know how to use basic http auth on zipkin docker compose or helm chart. Are these parameters already available; i can't see them any documentation or examples.

doc was missing in the helm chart https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin-helm/pull/20

for docker, it is the normal env style. here's an example of setting env https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/blob/master/docker/examples/docker-compose-elasticsearch.yml#L32

the variable are `ES_USERNAME` and `ES_PASSWORD` https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/tree/master/zipkin-server#elasticsearch-storage
was this success? how did you do it

I am using Spring Boot with Eureka and Zipkin for distributed tracing. However, I am encountering an issue where the Zipkin traces include a lot of noise from Eureka status and health check endpoints. This is cluttering my tracing data and making it difficult to focus on the relevant service interactions.

I would like to disable Zipkin tracing for the following endpoints:

/eureka/status
/eureka/health
Is there a way to configure Zipkin or Spring Cloud Sleuth to exclude these specific endpoints from being traced?
depends on https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/pull/3775 as the docker images reference package versions that no longer exist
security check will fail until #3774 because this doesn't update main deps. so we can ignore it until then
actually security fail is npm but anyway we need this in so that the build can run.
thanks for the look @reta!
@matthenry87 not OP, but my workaround was to manually define index templates that match the Zipkin ones and then assign an ILM to them.
I meet the same issue. armeria client default timeout is 10s, it‘s due to ES response over 10s
Huh, security is also happy now )
Can you draft a new release with the fixes, please?

The latest version (3.4.2) docker image still has this issue,
According to the above description, I repackaged it 
```
docker build -t zipkin-3.4.2-jdk-21.0.4 -f Dockerfile .
```
```
# Dockerfile
FROM openzipkin/zipkin:3.4.2 as zipkin

FROM amazoncorretto:21.0.4-alpine3.18 as install

COPY --from=zipkin /usr/local/bin/ /usr/local/bin/

ARG USER=zipkin

WORKDIR /${USER}

RUN adduser -g '' -h ${PWD} -D ${USER}

COPY --from=zipkin --chown=${USER} /zipkin/ /zipkin/

USER ${USER}

ENTRYPOINT ["start-zipkin"]

```
Directly specifying sasl.jaas.config will still result in other errors
```
docker run -p 9412:9411 \
> -e KAFKA_BOOTSTRAP_SERVERS=192.168.41.65:9072 \
> -e JAVA_OPTS="-Xms160m -Xmx160m -XX:+ExitOnOutOfMemoryError -Dzipkin.collector.kafka.overrides.security.protocol=SASL_PLAINTEXT -Dzipkin.collector.kafka.overrides.sasl.mechanism=SCRAM-SHA-256 -Dzipkin.collector.kafka.overrides.sasl.jaas.config='org.apache.kafka.common.security.scram.ScramLoginModule required username=\"kafka\" password=\"123456\";'" \
> zipkin-3.4.2-jdk-21.0.4
Error: Could not find or load main class required
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: required
```

But it can be used normally by mounting files
```
// cat /home/abc/kafka_client_jaas.conf 
KafkaClient {
    org.apache.kafka.common.security.scram.ScramLoginModule required
    username="kafka"
    password="123456";
};
```
```
docker run -p 9413:9411 \
> -e KAFKA_BOOTSTRAP_SERVERS=192.168.41.65:9072 \
> -e JAVA_OPTS='-Xms160m -Xmx160m -XX:+ExitOnOutOfMemoryError -Dzipkin.collector.kafka.overrides.security.protocol=SASL_PLAINTEXT -Dzipkin.collector.kafka.overrides.sasl.mechanism=SCRAM-SHA-256 -Djava.security.auth.login.config=/kafka_client_jaas.conf' \
> -v /home/abc/kafka_client_jaas.conf:/kafka_client_jaas.conf \
> zipkin-3.4.2-jdk-21.0.4
```

It is always normal to run using jar packages
```shell
// curl -sSL https://zipkin.io/quickstart.sh | bash -s
KAFKA_BOOTSTRAP_SERVERS=192.168.41.65:9072 \
java -Dzipkin.collector.kafka.overrides.security.protocol=SASL_PLAINTEXT -Dzipkin.collector.kafka.overrides.sasl.mechanism=SCRAM-SHA-256 -Djava.security.auth.login.config=/home/abc/kafka_client_jaas.conf -jar zipkin-server-3.4.2-exec.jar

KAFKA_BOOTSTRAP_SERVERS=192.168.41.65:9072  \
java -Dzipkin.collector.kafka.overrides.security.protocol=SASL_PLAINTEXT -Dzipkin.collector.kafka.overrides.sasl.mechanism=SCRAM-SHA-256 -Dzipkin.collector.kafka.overrides.sasl.jaas.config="org.apache.kafka.common.security.scram.ScramLoginModule required username=\"kafka\" password=\"123456\";" -jar zipkin-server-3.4.2-exec.jar
```

@reta @making @shakuzen  what's left is the UI (zipkin-lens) CVE which cannot be automatically fixed as it seems there's a breaking change. This PR is against the main repo, so PRs can go against it if someone doesn't have access to add a commit. Once done, back on track. Appreciate a hand pinging someone to help with this, or doing it directly.

```
┌───────────────────────┬────────────────┬──────────┬────────┬───────────────────┬───────────────┬─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│ Library │ Vulnerability │ Severity │ Status │ Installed Version │ Fixed Version │ Title │
├───────────────────────┼────────────────┼──────────┼────────┼───────────────────┼───────────────┼─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│ cross-spawn │ https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3xgq-45jj-v275 │ HIGH │ fixed │ 6.0.5 │ 7.0.5, 6.0.6 │ Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) in cross-spawn │
│ │ │ │ │ │ │ https://avd.aquasec.com/nvd/cve-2024-21538 │
│ │ │ │ ├───────────────────┤ │ │
│ │ │ │ │ 7.0.3 │ │ │

│ │ │ │ │ │ │ https://avd.aquasec.com/nvd/cve-2024-21536 │
└───────────────────────┴────────────────┴──────────┴────────┴───────────────────┴───────────────┴─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

suggestion: why don't we bump, merge and release this (after updating deps unrelated to docker). In the release notes, we can say "help wanted" to fix the remaining CVEs in the UI. Some don't use the UI at all, and/or might not care about those CVEs. Meanwhile, if no one can help fix them, we shouldn't hold the rest of the project and downstream hostage.
